HCM801.name: Critical Thinking and Innovation in Healthcare
HCM801.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM801.description: Critical thinking and innovation as vital management tools for healthcare professionals. Strategies for dealing with cognitive biases and unrecognized assumptions. Determining causality. Navigating pathways in critical reasoning. Maximizing reasoning effectiveness. Developing and implementing innovative design, processes, and leadership in healthcare.
HCM801.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM802.name: Cost Analysis in Healthcare
HCM802.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM802.description: Cost accounting and management control tools and techniques for making value-added decisions in important healthcare contexts. Topics will include (a) Cost Analysis
HCM802.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM803.name: Financial Analysis in Healthcare
HCM803.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM803.description: Principles of financial accounting applied to healthcare organizations, emphasizing application of key financial accounting tools and concepts for managerial decisions.
HCM803.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM804.name: Financial Management in Healthcare
HCM804.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM804.description: Financial management tools for investment and financing decision making in healthcare firms. Risk, valuation, capital budgeting. Analysis of the financial condition of the firm through the examination of financial statements. Current events and applications.
HCM804.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM805.name: Quality, Risk, and Performance Management
HCM805.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM805.description: Managing healthcare performance by means of quality initiatives, process management, and risk management. Relevant methods, principles, processes, strategies and systems thinking.
HCM805.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM806.name: Healthcare Information Systems
HCM806.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM806.description: Issues in the management and implementation of healthcare information systems and application of information technologies to support the effective and efficient delivery of healthcare work processes to stakeholders. The relationship between quality management and information management. Technology standards, security, and emerging technologies. Healthcare analytics.
HCM806.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM807.name: Law and Ethics in Healthcare
HCM807.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM807.description: Legal and ethical doctrines, principles, applications, and issues in healthcare organizations. Legal and ethical dimensions of decision making, administrative law, and planning in healthcare.
HCM807.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM808.name: Healthcare Systems and Economic Policy
HCM808.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM808.description: Organization of U.S. health system, policy process, and services. Dynamics of economic theory, valuation, financing and delivery of healthcare.
HCM808.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM809.name: Organizational Behavior in Healthcare
HCM809.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM809.description: Role of workforce leadership in fulfilling the goals and mission of healthcare organizations. Theories and applications of organizational behavior principles to motivating, rewarding, and structuring employees' work. Managing groups and teams. Structuring the organization. Domestic and international issues in the workplace.
HCM809.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM810.name: Human Resource Management in Healthcare
HCM810.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM810.description: Human resource management for healthcare organizations. Strategies for human resource recruitment, utilization, productivity, compensation, and development.
HCM810.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM811.name: Healthcare Strategic Management
HCM811.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM811.description: Examines ways top managers create and sustain competitive advantage in today's challenging healthcare marketplace from a total firm perspective.
HCM811.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM812.name: Supply Chain Management in Healthcare
HCM812.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM812.description: Concepts and tools of supply chain management related to healthcare settings. Management of resources, sourcing, operations, inventory, logistics, and capacity for effective services, quality, and cost performance.
HCM812.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM813.name: Healthcare Services Marketing
HCM813.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM813.description: The principles and processes of marketing and its role in effectively managing healthcare services for improvement and policy making.
HCM813.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM814.name: Hospitality and the Patient Experience
HCM814.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM814.description: The patient experience in healthcare as it relates to hospitality marketing, service quality management, patient well-being, and the role that leadership plays in the process.
HCM814.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM815.name: Managerial Epidemiology and Population Health
HCM815.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM815.description: Epidemiological concepts for decision-making in healthcare organizations. Managerial strategies for applying population health principles to disease assessment, community forecasting, cost effectiveness, and utilization of services.
HCM815.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM816.name: Healthcare Management Capstone
HCM816.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM816.description: Integrates the coursework, skills and perspectives in the program in a project, paper, or practicum. Brings cumulative knowledge to bear on specific healthcare management issues, dilemmas and gaps.
HCM816.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM817.name: Healthcare Leadership
HCM817.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM817.description: Review of leadership theories and practices as applied in healthcare organizations. Development of leadership skills.
HCM817.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM818.name: Strategic Decision Making
HCM818.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM818.description: Explores the process of strategic decision-making in healthcare organizations. Identifies issues that impeded and improve decision success. Examines a range of contextual factors that influence the decision process.
HCM818.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM819.name: Market Analysis and Planning
HCM819.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM819.description: Techniques, systems and formats to comprehend healthcare market forces and develop value-based healthcare marketing plans.
HCM819.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM820.name: Negotiations
HCM820.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM820.description: Fundamentals of effective negotiations in healthcare organizations. Planning for negotiation, integrative and distributive negotiation strategies, power and influence, ethics and interpersonal communication. Experience in negotiating through simulations and follow-up discussions.
HCM820.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM821.name: Healthcare Regulations
HCM821.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM821.description: Examines the role of regulations in the healthcare industry, focusing on standards of regulatory and accreditation organizations. Explores regulation in relationship to organizational culture and performance.
HCM821.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM822.name: Healthcare Compliance
HCM822.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM822.description: Explores the importance of compliance in healthcare organizations. Effective healthcare compliance, governance issues, fiduciary responsibilities, and challenges faced in the healthcare industry.
HCM822.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM823.name: Enterprise Risk Management
HCM823.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM823.description: Best approaches, academic and practical, to creating and implementing an Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) system. Examines ERM from a healthcare perspective. Key risk frameworks and tools for critical analysis of issues.
HCM823.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM824.name: Implementing Compliance Systems
HCM824.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM824.description: Implementation, execution, and enforcement of healthcare compliance programs. Current issues in compliance systems and healthcare sectors, and relationships with the federal government and accrediting agencies.
HCM824.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Healthcare Management Major.

HCM825.name: Analytics in Healthcare
HCM825.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
HCM825.description: Overview of the concepts and methods of business analytics as it relates to healthcare management. Examination of the role of analytics in transforming the business practice of healthcare, including a better assessment of cost effectiveness, learning curves in the practice of medicine, identifying best practices for evidence-based medicine.
